courseTitle: Foundations of Education, Physical Education and Health
courseDescription: Teacher candidates gain insight into the techniques, methodology, and philosophy of field-based health and physical education teachers. Teacher candidates will be expected to observe and participate in the teaching of simple lessons. This course requires a completed ODU clearance/background check prior to entering a school or community agency. Visit: odu.edu/oce for clearance procedures. If students do not have the clearance by the first week of classes, they will be dropped. This course requires a 20 hour placement in an elementary setting.

Teacher candidates gain insight into the techniques, methodology, and philosophy of field-based health and physical education teachers. Teacher candidates will be expected to observe and participate in the teaching of simple lessons.

This course covers skills and strategies of team sports, where opposing teams interact directly and simultaneously to achieve an objective. The team sports will be broken down into the components of territory, net/wall, and fielding/run scoring games. The student teacher will become familiar with teaching and organizational techniques appropriate for each activity. Emphasis is placed on a tactical approach and knowledge of sport specific skills, game strategy, rules, teaching facilitation, organization, and demonstration of different parts of a lesson.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of rules for different team sports

courseDescription: This course is designed as both a laboratory and methods class in which the student learns skills and strategies of pickleball, bowling, badminton, golf, tennis, gymnastics, and dance. It is designed to develop knowledge, understanding, and attitudes of fundamental movements. The student teacher will become familiar with teaching and organizational techniques appropriate for each activity. Emphasis is placed on a tactical approach and knowledge of specific skills, game strategy, rules, teaching facilitation, organization, and demonstration of different parts of a lesson.
Technical and Digital Skills: Specific skillset for individual sports and dance
Familiarity with different sports and dance equipment
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adaptability to different sports and dance styles
Analyzing game plays for strategic improvements

courseDescription: This course provides an opportunity for in-depth study of selected topics in physical education.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of sports and exercise equipment
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Creation and adjustment of fitness plans

courseDescription: This course is designed to acquaint the teacher candidate with elementary age children, their characteristics, interests, needs, and learning styles. Observation, analysis, and prescription of motor skills, curriculum design using skill themes and movement concepts are aimed at providing the teacher candidate with an increased understanding of how these actions directly relate to the process of effective teaching. Includes a 15 hour field experience.
Technical and Digital Skills: Observation and analysis of motor skills
Curriculum design using skill themes and movement concepts
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Understanding and addressing elementary age children's characteristics, interests, and needs
Effective teaching methods for diverse learning styles
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Prescription of motor skills based on individual needs
Analysis of learning styles to optimize teaching methods
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading and managing a physical education class
Coordinating and executing a 15 hour field experience

courseTitle: Methods and Materials in Teaching Physical Education
courseDescription: This course is designed to acquaint the teacher candidate with the current theories, techniques, and practices utilized in teaching physical education at the secondary level. Discussions will focus on the various age group characteristics, interests, needs and learning styles as related to a school setting. Observation, analysis, and prescription of motor skills, movement concepts, instructional techniques, and curriculum models are aimed at providing the professional educator with an increased understanding of how these factors directly relate to a process of effective teaching.  This writing intensive course includes a 15 hour field experience.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Observation and analysis of motor skills
Adapting teaching techniques to specific needs

courseTitle: Driver Education Foundations of Traffic Safety
courseDescription: The intent of the course is to develop a thorough understanding of the highway transportation systems, the complexity of the driving task, and factors contributing to performance of highway users (e.g. attitudes and skills) necessary to develop competent drivers.  The course will provide prospective teachers with the essential knowledge and skills to effectively deliver course content as an endorsed driver education trainer.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of factors contributing to performance of highway users
Ability to deliver course content as an endorsed driver education trainer
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to influence attitudes and skills of drivers
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing complexity of the driving task
Identifying factors contributing to performance of highway users

courseTitle: Principles and Methodologies of Classroom and In-Car Instruction
courseDescription: This course provides teacher candidates with an overview of teaching methods and effective practices for driver education instruction with a focus on teaching skills. An emphasis is placed on program organization, administration, classroom instruction, single car instruction, multiple-car range instruction, simulation and evaluation. A minimum of 20 hours behind-the-wheel supervised teaching experiences.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Adapting teaching methods to individual learning styles
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and addressing student learning challenges

courseDescription: This course is an examination of the physical growth and motor development of the human being over the life span. Emphasis is on the assessment of physical and cognitive development, particularly in the K-12 ages. Theory and technique for research are discussed and the use of research findings is incorporated into the assessment materials. Attention is directed toward acquisition of basic skills, perceptual-motor development, and age-related changes.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of physical growth and motor development

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide the student with experiences in the practical application of theory related to motor learning. Feedback, transfer learning, practice, and motor control principles and concepts are addressed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Practical application of motor learning theory
Understanding of practice principles in motor control
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Teaching and instructing motor learning principles
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem solving in motor learning applications
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and planning motor learning exercises

courseDescription: This course presents the knowledge, skills, and teaching techniques essential for proper care in emergency and sport injury situations. Aspects of emergency first aid, sport specific injury recognition and care, and CPR will be covered. Upon satisfactory completion of the course and payment of certification fees, students will receive a two-year certification in first aid and CPR. Students will have the option of taking the sports first aid certification test from ASEP for coaching.
Technical and Digital Skills: Sport specific injury recognition and care

courseTitle: Teaching of Health and Physical Education, Pre-K-8
courseDescription: This course is designed to prepare classroom teachers in PreK-8 licensure programs for the teaching of health and physical education.  Appropriate content, instructional strategies, effective classroom management, and safety issues and requirements will be presented.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of health and physical education content
Understanding of safety requirements in a classroom setting
Instructional strategies for health and physical education
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Active listening to understand student needs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Implementing effective solutions for safety issues
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and organizing physical education activities

courseDescription: Final field placement required for all students with an emphasis in a coaching minor. Students will be placed in an athletic coaching environment to gain experience in personal communication, technique instruction, practice organization and administrative duties required of the specific sport of their emphasis. Placement of internship subject to instructor approval. Minimum of 200 clock hours (hours to be arranged).
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification and implementation of effective coaching strategies

courseTitle: Management Skills for Teaching Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: Foundations in psychological, sociological, and academic needs of students, with specific focus on management skills in open classroom and sport settings. Specialized safety concerns and environmental considerations are also addressed. Lesson planning, goal setting, and movement formations unique to HPE activities are included.
Technical and Digital Skills: Management of open classroom and sport settings
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Understanding psychological, sociological, and academic needs of students
Communication in open classroom and sport settings

courseTitle: Methods and Materials in Health Education
courseDescription: This course will enable teacher candidates to gain insight into the techniques, methodology, and philosophy of field-based health and physical education. Teacher candidates will be expected to observe and participate in the teaching of simple lessons.
Technical and Digital Skills: Methodology application in field-based health education
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting techniques for varied learning environments

courseDescription: Students will become acquainted with the practices and researching of different disabilities, the learning modes of the exceptional child, and IDEA (the law that advocates free and appropriate education). The course will also examine how to work within the ecosystem surrounding a child with disabilities. A vital component of the course will be the practical application of theory.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of IDEA law and its implications
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Working effectively within the ecosystem surrounding a child with disabilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing learning modes of the exceptional child
Identifying and addressing challenges faced by children with disabilities
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and implementing appropriate education strategies for children with disabilities
Adapting teaching methods to suit individual child's needs

courseTitle: Tests and Measurement in Physical Education and Health
courseDescription: This course is designed to acquaint the student with tests and measurement in the fields of health and physical education, test construction, scoring, and methods of using results.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data analysis in health and physical education
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Cooperating with other health and physical education professionals
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Applying tests and measurements in practical settings

courseDescription: An investigation into the physiological adjustments of the human organism to exercise, including systematic and biochemical molecular changes. Major areas of concern include neuromuscular, metabolic, and cardiorespiratory changes during exercise and the influence of such variables as nutrition, drugs, environment, age, sex, training and body weight.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of systematic and biochemical molecular changes
Knowledge of neuromuscular, metabolic, and cardiorespiratory changes during exercise
Understanding of nutrition, drugs, environment, age, sex, training and body weight influences on exercise
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating the impact of variables on exercise performance

courseDescription: This course is designed to provide students with a basic knowledge of the coaching profession. Special emphasis will be placed on establishing a sound coaching philosophy, selecting a coaching style, desirable qualities of a coach, ethics and the coach, roles of the head coach, planning and organizing for games and practices, coaching pedagogy, off-season planning, final preparations for the season, and issues and problems related to coaching and recruiting athletes.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Conveying desirable qualities of a coach
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Resolving issues related to coaching and recruiting
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Understanding roles of the head coach
Planning and organizing for games and practices

courseDescription: The study of techniques for the teaching of nutrition and health-related fitness. Content to be covered includes nutrition and various aspects of fitness training appropriate for the teaching of PreK-12 physical education and health.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of various aspects of fitness training
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adaptation of fitness training to age groups
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and structuring physical education lessons
Leadership in health and fitness education

courseDescription: Study of the psychological bases of coaching strategies and methodologies. Emphasis is placed on applying knowledge in field settings.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Application of psychological knowledge in problem-solving

courseTitle: Practicum Experience and Instructional Planning in Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: Instructional planning coupled with a clinical experience that allows the teaching candidate to teach and observe professionals in a field-based setting. Portfolio development, reflective assessment of teaching, and student assessment techniques will be emphasized. This course requires a completed ODU clearance/background check prior to entering a school or community agency. Visit: https://www.odu.edu/oce for clearance procedures. If students do not have the clearance by the first week of classes, they will be dropped.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Observation and interpretation of professional practices

courseDescription: Study and group discussion of problems growing out of the student teaching (teacher candidate internship) experience.

A culminating experience that provides a field-based application of effective techniques in behavior, management, instructional strategies, and the development of professional attributes in K-12 school setting.  This course requires a completed ODU clearance/background check prior to entering a school or community agency. Visit: https://www.odu.edu/oce for clearance procedures. If students do not have the clearance by the first week of classes, they will be dropped.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Interacting with school and community agencies
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in a K-12 school setting
Adherence to clearance and background check procedures

courseTitle: Topics in Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: A study of specialized topics in health and physical education.
Technical and Digital Skills: Ability to use fitness tracking technology
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate health and fitness concepts
Empathy and understanding in health education
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Assessment of individual and group health needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Implementation of health and fitness programs

courseTitle: Topics in Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: A study of specialized topics in health and physical education.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of health and fitness tracking technology
Digital record keeping of health data
Using digital tools for physical education

courseTitle: Methods and Materials in Health Education
courseDescription: This course will enable teacher candidates to gain insight into the techniques, methodology, and philosophy of field-based health and physical education. Teacher candidates will be expected to observe and participate in the teaching of simple lessons.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting teaching techniques to different learning styles
Evaluating effectiveness of health education methods

courseDescription: Students will become acquainted with the practices and researching of different disabilities, the learning modes of the exceptional child, and IDEA (the law that advocates free and appropriate education). The course will also examine how to work within the ecosystem surrounding a child with disabilities. A vital component of the course will be the practical application of theory.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Working within the ecosystem surrounding a child with disabilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Understanding the learning modes of the exceptional child
Identifying appropriate education methods for different disabilities
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing educational plans for children with disabilities
Leading educational activities for children with disabilities

courseTitle: Tests and Measurement in Physical Education and Health
courseDescription: This course is designed to acquaint the student with tests and measurement in the fields of health and physical education, test construction, scoring, and methods of using results.

An investigation into the physiological adjustments of the human organism to exercise, including systematic and biochemical molecular changes. Major areas of concern include neuromuscular, metabolic, and cardiorespiratory changes during exercise and the influence of such variables as nutrition, drugs, environment, age, sex, training and body weight.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of physiological adjustments to exercise
Knowledge of systematic and biochemical molecular changes
Understanding of neuromuscular, metabolic, and cardiorespiratory changes during exercise
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing the influence of variables such as nutrition, drugs, environment, age, sex, training and body weight on exercise physiology

courseDescription: The study of techniques for the teaching of nutrition and health-related fitness. Content to be covered includes nutrition and various aspects of fitness training appropriate for the teaching of PreK-12 physical education and health.
Technical and Digital Skills: Ability to use digital tools for health and fitness education
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate health and fitness concepts
Adapting communication to different age groups
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Designing fitness programs based on individual needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and organizing health and fitness curricula

courseTitle: Practicum Experience and Instructional Planning in Health and Physical Education
courseDescription: A clinical experience that allows the teaching candidate to teach and observe professionals in a field-based setting. Portfolio development, reflective assessment of teaching, and student assessment techniques will be emphasized. This course requires a completed ODU clearance/background check prior to entering a school or community agency. Visit: www.odu.edu/TES for clearance procedures. If students do not have the clearance by the first week of classes, they will be dropped.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of ODU clearance/background check procedures

courseDescription: Study and group discussion of problems growing out of the student teaching (teacher candidate internship) experience. Students must pass Praxis II to complete this course.

courseTitle: Adapted Physical Education Design and Supervision
courseDescription: This course is divided into three sections. The first section deals with learning how to administer and interpret several evaluation tools. The second section concentrates on developing computer, videotaping, and other technology skills for adapted PE. The third section focuses on overall supervision of adapted PE programs in various school and institutional environments.
Technical and Digital Skills: Developing computer skills for adapted PE
Understanding and utilizing other relevant technologies for adapted PE
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Explaining the interpretation of evaluation tools
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpreting the results of evaluation tools
Analyzing the effectiveness of adapted PE programs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing PE programs in various school and institutional environments

courseTitle: Movement Analysis of Individual and Team Sports
courseDescription: This laboratory and methods class focuses on the skills and strategies of teaching individual sports (e.g., bowling, badminton, golf, and tennis) and team sports (e.g., football, basketball, volleyball, and softball), using a tactical approach.
Technical and Digital Skills: Teaching sports techniques such as golf, tennis, football, and basketball

courseTitle: Principles of Movement Analysis in Dance and Rhythmic Activities for Physical Education
courseDescription: The course is designed to help teachers and coaches improve their skills in analyzing movement skills in dance and rhythmic activities. Such skill analysis is necessary to effectively diagnose movement deficiencies, prescribe techniques for improving performance, and modifying activities for the adaptive program.
Technical and Digital Skills: Analyzing movement skills in dance and rhythmic activities
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Providing clear instructions for technique improvement
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing individual and group learning processes

courseTitle: Research Problems in Health & Physical Education
courseDescription: Practice in the use of statistical and analytical techniques in solving problems in health and physical education; supervised student research.
Technical and Digital Skills: Conducting health and physical education research
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving in health and physical education

courseDescription: Designed to provide detailed practical experience (400 clock hours) in a health and physical education field setting.
Technical and Digital Skills: Practical application of health and physical education theory
Usage of health monitoring digital tools
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Interacting with diverse groups in a field setting
Communication of health and fitness instructions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting physical education strategies to individual needs
Assessment and improvement of health and fitness plans
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in health and fitness environment

courseDescription: Problems in teaching health education on the elementary and secondary level; family life education, substance use and abuse, and mental and emotional health.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of substance abuse prevention strategies
Familiarity with mental and emotional health topics
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Empathy and understanding in sensitive topics
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Addressing diverse health issues in educational settings
Analyzing effectiveness of health education methods
Problem-solving in context of health education
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and implementing health education curriculum

courseDescription: Selected topic courses in health and physical education.
Technical and Digital Skills: Usage of health and fitness tracking tools
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication within health and fitness environment

courseTitle: Independent Study In Health & Physical Education
courseDescription: Investigations in health, physical education. Problems approved in advance are investigated under the supervision of the faculty advisor.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Investigation of health and physical education problems

courseDescription: Thesis.
Thesis.

courseTitle: Advanced Studies in Adapted Physical Education
courseDescription: This course provides experiences of teaching adapted physical education content in lecture and gymnasium settings. Students will develop an understanding of a broad spectrum of disability related content that is applicable to physical education, and gain a deep knowledge of specific topics within disability studies. General and disability specific teaching strategies will be discussed.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing specific topics within disability studies
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing physical education sessions for individuals with disabilities
Leading educational activities in different settings

courseDescription: This course examines applied theories of learning and coaching in sport and physical education. Emphasis will be placed on understanding the differing coaching/learning theories and strategies, designing effective practice and game plans, and learning the different learning levels and styles through observing, analyzing, and critiquing skills. Current research and practice will be emphasized.
Technical and Digital Skills: Designing effective practice and game plans
Understanding differing coaching/learning theories and strategies
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing different learning levels and styles
Applying theories of learning and coaching in practice
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and planning sports practice sessions

courseTitle: Planning and Administration in PE and Sport Programs
courseDescription: This course is designed to provide in-depth information about the planning and administrative aspects of sport/physical education programs. Content includes, but is not limited to, teaching/training planning, safety and injury prevention, behavioral management, field/facility maintenance, budgetary considerations, public relations, and legal and risk management procedures associated with coaching/teaching PE.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Safety and injury prevention in sports
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Legal management in sports and PE teaching

courseDescription: A course designed to acquaint the student with the basic principles and practices in curriculum development. Curriculum development methodologies for both K-12 and college curricula will be addressed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of K-12 and college curricula
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with educators and stakeholders

courseDescription: Motivational and psychological issues relate with sport performance enhancement, athlete/student wellbeing, and clinical issues with specific populations.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and resolving performance enhancement issues
Dealing with clinical issues within specific populations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing psychological and motivational aspects within a team

courseDescription: This course covers a combination of motor development and motor learning topics. The course information and structure are designed to optimize practitioners’ effectiveness in the classroom and on the field via practical application of motor behavior theories, concepts and principles. Attention is directed toward understanding the acquisition of skills from the fundamental, initial level to the sport-specific, more advanced level, toward optimal age and skill-level practices and developing appropriate motor skill assessments for infants through older adulthood. Past and current research findings are incorporated into each of the course topics.
Technical and Digital Skills: Ability to apply motor learning concepts and principles
Understanding of skill acquisition from fundamental to advanced levels
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication of complex motor learning principles
Practical application of theories in classroom and on the field
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of motor development and learning
Evaluation and application of past and current research findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Designing optimal age and skill-level practices
Managing motor skill development from infancy through older adulthood

courseDescription: This course covers assessment/evaluation theory and practices in PE/Sport. Multiple evaluation designs and techniques in different domains such as teaching/coaching, learning, and performance will be discussed along with technology applications in PE/Sport.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of evaluation designs and techniques
Usage of digital tools for assessment

courseTitle: Advanced Studies in Adapted Physical Education
courseDescription: This course provides experiences of teaching adapted physical education content in lecture and gymnasium settings. Students will develop an understanding of a broad spectrum of disability related content that is applicable to physical education, and gain a deep knowledge of specific topics within disability studies. General and disability specific teaching strategies will be discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of a broad spectrum of disability related content
Knowledge of specific topics within disability studies
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication in lecture and gymnasium settings
Engaging with students with different disabilities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing and adapting teaching strategies based on individual disabilities
Addressing unique challenges in physical education for individuals with disabilities
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and organization for diverse physical education classes
Leadership in a physically active setting

courseTitle: Planning and Administration in PE and Sport Programs
courseDescription: This course is designed to provide in-depth information about the planning and administrative aspects of sport/physical education programs. Content includes, but is not limited to, teaching/training planning, safety and injury prevention, behavioral management, field/facility maintenance, budgetary considerations, public relations, and legal and risk management procedures associated with coaching/teaching PE.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of legal and risk management procedures
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification and mitigation of safety risks

courseDescription: A course designed to acquaint the student with the basic principles and practices in curriculum development. Curriculum development methodologies for both K-12 and college curricula will be addressed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of K-12 and college curricula
Understanding of basic principles in curriculum development
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with educators and stakeholders in curriculum development
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting curricula to different educational levels
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing curricula for different educational levels

courseDescription: This course covers a combination of motor development and motor learning topics. The course information and structure are designed to optimize practitioners' effectiveness in the classroom and on the field via practical application of motor behavior theories, concepts and principles. Attention is directed toward understanding the acquisition of skills from the fundamental, initial level to the sport-specific, more advanced level, toward optimal age and skill-level practices and developing appropriate motor skill assessments for infants through older adulthood. Past and current research findings are incorporated into each of the course topics.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding skill acquisition from fundamental to advanced level
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Optimizing practitioner effectiveness in the classroom and on the field
Understanding and implementing optimal age and skill-level practices
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing current and past research findings
Determining appropriate motor skill assessments for varying age groups
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Directing attention towards key learning objectives
Incorporating research findings into course topics

courseDescription: This course covers assessment/evaluation theory and practices in PE/Sport. Multiple evaluation designs and techniques in different domains such as teaching/coaching, learning, and performance will be discussed along with technology applications in PE/Sport.
Technical and Digital Skills: Application of different evaluation designs and techniques
Proficiency in technology applications related to PE/Sport
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Explaining complex evaluation designs and results
Providing constructive feedback based on assessments
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing performance based on evaluation results
Critical evaluation of teaching/coaching techniques and learning processes
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading improvement strategies based on evaluation results

courseTitle: Advanced Quantitative Research in Adapted Physical Activity
courseDescription: This quantitative research method course delves into two aspects: (1) to understand the quantitative study design and evidence hierarchy as they relate to research and practices in adapted physical activity, and (2) to provide skills and understanding necessary for doctoral students in adapted physical activity to interpret and conduct quantitative research.
